page.title: 19HOLSWORTHY SHOW
page.content: The first recorded Holsworthy Agricultural Show was in 1886 and has continued as an annual event apart from the war years up to until today. The Show was originally for animal, butter and cream exhibits.However modern stalls include exhibitions of agricultural machinery , flowers , young farmers clubs displays , womens institute displays , show jumping , local club/school displays and general displays.Plus the judging of various types of farm animal including cattle , sheep , horses and pigs. The 1985 Show which was the 90th annual show more than lived up to the reputation it has created for itself . The attendance on a cool , rain threatening day was over 8000 people. It was a day for both visitors and farmers alike.The show usually occurs in the month of May.
